original:
Individual states in the United States have enacted laws and regulations designed to protect consumer privacy. A notable example is the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), which aims to enhance privacy rights and consumer protection for residents of California.

Concerns regarding consumer privacy have historical roots, tracing back to early commercial couriers and bankers who implemented stringent measures to safeguard customer inf
